Package remodel.util

Class PureCollection<T>

java.lang.Object
remodel.util.PureCollection<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
PureList, PureSet
public abstract class PureCollection<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<T>
PureCollection is the abstract ancestor of constructive collections. The descendants of PureCollection are PureSet and PureList. PureCollection provides common operations, such as isEmpty(), size() and iterator(). It provides common iteration operations forall() and exists(), and the selectors has() and detect().

PureCollection records at runtime the type of element that it contains, as a Class object. This is either determined at construction, or by inference as the least upper bound type of all the contained elements.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

  • Constructor Details

    • PureCollection

      public PureCollection()
      Creates a PureCollection with no specified element type. The value of elemType is null.

    • PureCollection

      public PureCollection​(java.lang.Class<?> elemType)
      Constructs a PureCollection with a known element type. The value of the field elemType is set to the specified class.
      Parameters:
      elemType - the class of the element.

  • Method Details

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
      Reports whether this PureCollection is equal to another Object. Returns true if the other Object is a PureCollection of the same size, and if this is a PureSet, it contains all the same elements as the other, and if this is a PureList, the elements are also in the same order.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Computes a quasi-unique hash code, based on the hash codes of the contained elements. If this is a PureSet, the element order is not significant; but if this is a PureList, element order is significant.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class java.lang.Object

    • getElemType

      public java.lang.Class<T> getElemType()
      Returns the element type object. If the value of elemType has been set, returns this. Otherwise, seeks to infer the elemType;
      Returns:
      the element type.

    • add

      public PureCollection<T> add​(T element)
      Adds an element (destructively) to this PureCollection. Adds the element to the underlying collection of elements.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to add.
      Returns:
      this PureCollection.

    • remove

      public PureCollection<T> remove​(T element)
      Removes an element (destructively) to this PureCollection. Removes the element from the underlying collection of elements.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to remove.
      Returns:
      this PureCollection.

    • iterator

      public java.util.Iterator<T> iterator()
      Returns an Iterator that visits each of the elements of this PureCollection. Returns a specific Iterator over the underlying collection of elements returned by getElements().
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<T>

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the size of this PureCollection. Returns the size of the underlying collection of elements returned by getElements().
      Returns:
      the size of this PureCollection.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Reports whether this PureCollection is empty. Reports whether the underlying collection of elements is empty.
      Returns:
      true if there are zero elements, otherwise false.

    • has

      public boolean has​(T element)
      Reports whether this PureCollection has a given element. Tests whether the underlying collection of elements contains the given element.
      Parameters:
      element - an element.
      Returns:
      true if this PureCollection has this element.

    • update

      public PureCollection<T> update​(Function<T,​T> function)
      Applies an updating function to every element of this PureCollection, for the sake of its side-effect.
      Parameters:
      function - the updating function.
      Returns:
      this PureCollection.

    • forall

      public boolean forall​(Predicate<T> predicate)
      Reports whether all the elements of this PureCollection satisfy a given predicate. If the collection is empty, returns true.
      Parameters:
      predicate - the test to apply.
      Returns:
      true if every element satisfies the test.

    • exists

      public boolean exists​(Predicate<T> predicate)
      Reports whether any element of this PureCollection satisfies a given predicate. If the collection is empty, returns false.
      Parameters:
      predicate - the test to apply.
      Returns:
      true if at least one element satisfies the test.

    • detect

      public T detect​(Predicate<T> predicate)
      Returns the first element of this PureCollection satisfying a given predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - the test to apply.
      Returns:
      the first satisfying element, or null.
